result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant James Deandre Scott in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant James Deandre Scott in court with Attorney Robert Hampton on behalf of Attorney Jade K Hall.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Boyack.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Turnover for level 5 supervision, all previously ordered conditions of bail remain the same.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant James Deandre Scott not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Case remains calendared for preliminary hearing 04-05-2022 at 8:30 am, Branch PE.

Defendant James Deandre Scott not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Hall is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. A new date has been selected with Attorney Hall by email. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant James Deandre Scott in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  Defendant James Deandre Scott in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
